results.title: Storytelling
results.creator_credit: Michael Milan and Audio Visual Learning Centre, University of Otago
results.brief_description: Elizabeth Miller, Young People’s Librarian at the Invercargill Public Library, New Zealand discusses her approach to the craft of storytelling: and demonstrates with a group of pre-schoolers and a class of 9-10 year olds. Suitable for tertiary level.

results.title: Storyboard
results.brief_description:
Storyboards help filmmaking teams visualise a film and how to tell the film’s story through images. In a film, the audience follows a story not just through character’s dialogue, but also through their actions. Even objects and settings help tell a story.

You can make decisions about how things will look by creating a storyboard. Each panel in a storyboard represents a camera shot and therefore what the camera will see and show. You do not have to recreate every frame of a film in a storyboard; that would take forever!

results.title: Story structures: finding the hook
results.creator_credit: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Video tech”.
Focuses on video storytelling through the analysis of story structure, telling the story, finding the hook to keep people interested, and visualising the story. It explores the six basic questions which must be answered in a story: Who? What? When? Where? Why? and How?

results.title: Story of Ted Hughes
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The story of the rehabilitation of a youth who lost a leg in an accident as a boy. The services rendered by the Rehabilitation Branch of the Social Services are indicated including physiotherapy, occupational therapy, study and recreation. Problems of employing disabled people are studied with recognition given to the fact that it is ability, not disability, that counts.

results.title: Story of petroleum
results.brief_description: Considers the uses of oil as fuel for transportation, heating and manufacturing. Explains how seismographs are used in exploring for oil, how drilling is carried out, how oil is refined, how the world’s petroleum resources are distributed.

results.title: Story of Anyburg, USA
results.creator_credit: Clyde Geronimi and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: A town over-run with traffic hazards puts the cars on trial in an effort to stamp out road acidents, reckless driving and speeding. Automobile factory workers and highway engineers give evidence. The Defence Lawyer proves that an accident was the result of a speeding man rather than a speeding car. The newspaper headlines scream: “Autos acquitted…people admit guilt!”

The newspaper headlines scream: “Autos acquitted…people admit guilt!”

results.title: Story in the rocks
results.creator_credit: Han Van Gelder, Bert Haanstra and Marten Toonder Films
results.brief_description: Fossils - the remains of ancient animals and plants preserved in rock strata - reveal little to the uninitiated, but an expert can read a whole history into the skeleton of a fish petrified in rock or reconstruct the appearance of an extinct animal from fragments of bone or even a footprint.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Han Van Gelder, Bert Haanstra and Marten Toonder Films

results.title: Story behind the tap
results.creator_credit: Richard C. Seeger and Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works
results.brief_description: Covers the water supply system of Melbourne from three main catchment areas. Shows water from the catchments supplying storages, then to the suburban distribution reservoirs and finally mains distribution. The various forms of maintenance of the system, purification, and research work on supply problems to an ever-growing city are also presented.
